newsitem.title: USA: Realty ReFund stake cut by chairman.
newsitem.headline: Realty ReFund stake cut by chairman.

text.p: Alan Krause, chairmand and chief executive of Realty Refund Trust, said Thursday he cut his stake in the company to 25,000 shares of beneficial interest or 2.45 percent from 17.93 percent previously held.
In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Krause said he sold on December 16, 158,001 shares of benefical interest in a private sale at a price equal to $3.85 per share.
The purpose of the sale was for year-end tax planning purposes and to generate cash.
Realty, of Cleveland, Ohio, is an unincorporated association in the form of a business trust.
